member.name: T:SharpSploit.Credentials.Mimikatz
member.summary: (SharpSploit.Credentials.)Mimikatz is a library for executing Mimikatz functions. SharpSploit's implementation uses a PE Loader to execute Mimikatz functions. This is a wrapper class that loads the PE and executes user- specified Mimikatz functions
member.remarks: Mimikatz is a tool for playing with credentials in Windows, written by Benjamin Delpy (@gentilkiwi). (Found at https://github.com/gentilkiwi/mimikatz). SharpSploit's PE Loader is adapted from work by Casey Smith (@subtee). (No longer available at original location.) This wrapper class is adapted from Chris Ross (@xorrior)'s implementation. (Found at https://github.com/xorrior/Random-CSharpTools/tree/master/DllLoader/DllLoader)

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Credentials.Mimikatz.Command(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the Mimikatz PE with `PE.Load()` and executes a chosen Mimikatz command.
member.param: Mimikatz command to be executed.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Credentials.Mimikatz.LogonPasswords
member.summary: Loads the Mimikatz PE with `PE.Load()` and executes the Mimikatzcommand to retrieve plaintext passwords from LSASS. Equates to `Command("privilege::debug sekurlsa::logonPasswords")`. (Requires Admin)

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Credentials.Mimikatz.SamDump
member.summary: Loads the Mimikatz PE with `PE.Load()` and executes the Mimikatz command to retrieve password hashes from the SAM database. Equates to `Command("privilege::debug lsadump::sam")`. (Requires Admin)

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Credentials.Mimikatz.LsaSecrets
member.summary: Loads the Mimikatz PE with `PE.Load()` and executes the Mimikatz command to retrieve LSA secrets stored in registry. Equates to `Command("privilege::debug lsadump::secrets")`. (Requires Admin)

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Credentials.Mimikatz.LsaCache
member.summary: Loads the Mimikatz PE with `PE.Load()` and executes the Mimikatz command to retrieve Domain Cached Credentials hashes from registry. Equates to `Command("privilege::debug lsadump::cache")`. (Requires Admin)

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Credentials.Mimikatz.Wdigest
member.summary: Loads the Mimikatz PE with `PE.Load()` and executes the Mimikatz command to retrieve Wdigest credentials from registry. Equates to `Command("sekurlsa::wdigest")`.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Credentials.Mimikatz.All
member.summary: Loads the Mimikatz PE with `PE.Load()` and executes each of the builtin local commands (not DCSync). (Requires Admin)

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Credentials.Mimikatz.DCSync(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Loads the Mimikatz PE with `PE.Load()` and executes the "dcsync" module to retrieve the NTLM hash of a specified (or all) Domain user. (Requires Domain Admin)
member.param: Username to retrieve NTLM hash for. "All" for all domain users.
Optionally specify an alternative fully qualified domain name. Default is current domain.
Optionally specify a specific Domain Controller to target for the dcsync.
member.returns: The NTLM hash of the target user(s).

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Credentials.Mimikatz.PassTheHash(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Loads the Mimikatz PE with `PE.Load()` and executes the "pth" module to start a new process as a user using an NTLM password hash for authentication.
member.param: Username to authenticate as.
NTLM hash to authenticate the user.
Optionally specify an alternative fully qualified domain name. Default is current domain.
The command to execute as the specified user.

member.name: T:SharpSploit.Credentials.Tokens
member.summary: Tokens is a library for token manipulation that can be used to impersonate other users, run commands as other user, and/or to bypass UAC using token duplication.
member.remarks: Tokens is adapted from and borrows heavily from Alexander Leary's (@0xbadjuju) Tokenvator (Found at https://github.com/0xbadjuju/Tokenvator).

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Credentials.Tokens.#ctor
member.summary: Creates the Tokens class, attempts to obtain the current process' token, and obtain the SeDebugPrivilege.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Credentials.Tokens.Dispose
member.summary: Attempts to close all open handles.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Credentials.Tokens.WhoAmI
member.summary: Gets the username of the currently used/impersonated token.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Credentials.Tokens.ImpersonateUser(System.String)
member.summary: Find a process owned by the specificied user and impersonate the token. Used to execute subsequent commands as the specified user. (Requires Admin)
member.param: User to impersonate. "DOMAIN\Username" format expected.
member.returns: True if impersonation succeeds, false otherwise.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Credentials.Tokens.ImpersonateProcess(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Impersonate the token of the specified process. Used to execute subsequent commands as the user associated with the token of the specified process. (Requires Admin)
member.param: Process ID of the process to impersonate.
member.returns: True if impersonation succeeds, false otherwise.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Credentials.Tokens.GetSystem
member.summary: Impersonate the SYSTEM user. Equates to `ImpersonateUser("NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM")`. (Requires Admin)
member.returns: True if impersonation succeeds, false otherwise.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Credentials.Tokens.BypassUAC(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Bypasses UAC through token duplication and spawns a specified process. (Requires Admin)
member.param: The binary to execute with high integrity.
Arguments to pass to the binary.
Path that the binary resides in.
Specify the process for which to perform token duplication. By deafult (0), all appropriate processes will be tried.
member.returns: True if UAC bypass succeeeds, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Credit for the UAC bypass token duplication technique goes to James Forshaw (@tiraniddo). Credit for the PowerShell implementation of this bypass goes to Matt Nelson (@enigma0x3).

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Credentials.Tokens.RunAs``1(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Func{``0},SharpSploit.Execution.Win32.Advapi32.LOGON_TYPE)
member.summary: Makes a new token to run a specified function as a specified user with a specified password. Automatically calls `RevertToSelf()` after executing the function.
member.typeparam: Type of object to be return by the Action function.
member.param: Username to execute Action as.
Domain to authenticate the user to.
Password to authenticate the user.
Action to perform as the user
LogonType to use. Defaults to LOGON32_LOGON_INTERACTIVE, which is suitable for local actions. LOGON32_LOGON_NEW_CREDENTIALS is suitable to perform actions which require remote authentication.
member.returns: Object returned by the Action function.
member.remarks: Credit to https://github.com/mj1856/SimpleImpersonation for the awesome Func(T) idea.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Credentials.Tokens.MakeToken(System.String,System.String,System.String,SharpSploit.Execution.Win32.Advapi32.LOGON_TYPE)
member.summary: Makes a new token with a specified username and password, and impersonates it to conduct future actions as the specified user.
member.param: Username to authenticate as.
Domain to authenticate the user to.
Password to authenticate the user.
LogonType to use. Defaults to LOGON32_LOGON_NEW_CREDENTIALS, which is suitable to perform actions which require remote authentication. LOGON32_LOGON_INTERACTIVE is suitable for local actions
member.returns: True if impersonation succeeds, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Credit to @rsmudge for the technique detailed here: https://blog.cobaltstrike.com/2015/12/16/windows-access-tokens-and-alternate-credentials

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Credentials.Tokens.RevertToSelf
member.summary: Ends the impersonation of any token, reverting back to the initial token associated with the current process. Useful in conjuction with functions that impersonate a token and do not automatically RevertToSelf, such as: `ImpersonateUser()`, `ImpersonateProcess()`, `GetSystem()`, and `MakeToken()`.
member.returns: True if RevertToSelf succeeds, false otherwise.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Credentials.Tokens.EnableTokenPrivilege(System.IntPtr@,System.String)
member.summary: Enables a specified security privilege for a specified token.
member.param: Token to enable a security privilege for.
Privilege to enable.
member.returns: True if enabling Token succeeds, false otherwise.

member.name: T:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Domain
member.summary: Domain is a library for domain enumeration that can be used to search for and query for information from DomainObjects such as users, groups, and computers.
member.remarks: Domain is adapted from Will Schroeder's (@harmj0y) PowerView (Found at https://github.com/PowerShellMafia/PowerSploit/blob/dev/Recon/PowerView.ps1)

member.name: T:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Domain.DomainSearcher
member.summary: DomainSearcher is a LDAP searcher class for domain enumeration.
member.remarks: DomainSearcher is adapted from Will Schroeder's (@harmj0y) PowerView. (Found at https://github.com/PowerShellMafia/PowerSploit/blob/dev/Recon/PowerView.ps1)

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Domain.DomainSearcher.#ctor(SharpSploit.Enumeration.Domain.Credential,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.DirectoryServices.SearchScope,System.Int32,System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean,System.DirectoryServices.SecurityMasks)
member.summary: Constructor for the DomainSearcher class.
member.param: Optional alternative Credentials to authenticate to the Domain.
Optional alternative Domain to authenticate to and search.
Optional alternative Server within the Domain to authenticate to and search.
Optional SearchBase to prepend to all LDAP searches.
Optional SearchString to append to SearchBase for all LDAP searches.
Optional SearchScope for the underlying DirectorySearcher object.
Optional ResultPageSize for the underlying DirectorySearcher object.
Optional max time limit for the server per search.
Optionally retrieve deleted/tombstoned DomainObjects
Optional SecurityMasks for the underlying DirectorySearcher object.

member.summary: Gets a specified user `DomainObject` in the current Domain.
member.param: Username to search for.
Optional LDAP filter to apply to the search.
Optional list of properties to retrieve from the DomainObject. If not specified, all properties are included.
Optional filter to parse the userAccountControl DomainObject property.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject with an SPN set.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject that allows for delegation.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject that does not allow for delegation.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject with the AdminCount property set.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject that is trusted to authenticate for other DomainObjects
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject does not require Kerberos preauthentication.

member.summary: Gets a list of specified (or all) user `DomainObject`s in the current Domain.
member.param: Optional list of usernames to search for.
Optional LDAP filter to apply to the search.
Optional list of properties to retrieve from the DomainObject. If not specified, all properties are included.
Optional filter to parse the userAccountControl DomainObject property.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject with an SPN set.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject that allows for delegation.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject that does not allow for delegation.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject with the AdminCount property set.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject that is trusted to authenticate for other DomainObjects
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject does not require Kerberos preauthentication.
Optionally find only the first matching DomainObject.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Domain.DomainSearcher.GetDomainGroup(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a specified group `DomainObject` in the current Domain.
member.param: Group name to search for.
Optional LDAP filter to apply to the search.
Optional list of properties to retrieve from the DomainObject. If not specified, all properties are included.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject with the AdminCount property set.
Optionally filter for a GroupScope (DomainLocal, Global, Universal, etc).
Optionally filter for a GroupProperty (Security, Distribution, CreatedBySystem, NotCreatedBySystem,etc)

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Domain.DomainSearcher.GetDomainGroups(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a list of specified (or all) group `DomainObject`s in the current Domain.
member.param: Optional list of group names to search for.
Optional LDAP filter to apply to the search.
Optional list of properties to retrieve from the DomainObject. If not specified, all properties are included.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject with the AdminCount property set.
Optionally filter for a GroupScope (DomainLocal, Global, Universal, etc).
Optionally filter for a GroupProperty (Security, Distribution, CreatedBySystem, NotCreatedBySystem,etc).
Optionally find only the first matching DomainObject.

member.summary: Gets a specified computer `DomainObject` in the current Domain.
member.param: ComputerName to search for
Optional LDAP filter to apply to the search.
Optional list of properties to retrieve from the DomainObject. If not specified, all properties are included.
Optional filter to parse the userAccountControl DomainObject property.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject that has unconstrained delegation.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject that is trusted to authenticate for other DomainObjects
Optionally return only a DomainObject that is a printer.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject with an SPN set.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject with a specific Operating System, wildcards accepted.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject with a specific service pack, wildcards accepted.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject in a specific Domain SiteName, wildcards accepted.
Optional switch, ping the computer to ensure it's up before enumerating.

member.summary: Gets a list of specified (or all) computer `DomainObject`s in the current Domain.
member.param: Optional list of ComputerNames to search for.
Optional LDAP filter to apply to the search.
Optional list of properties to retrieve from the DomainObject. If not specified, all properties are included.
Optional filter to parse the userAccountControl DomainObject property.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject that has unconstrained delegation.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject that is trusted to authenticate for other DomainObjects
Optionally return only a DomainObject that is a printer.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject with an SPN set.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject with a specific Operating System, wildcards accepted.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject with a specific service pack, wildcards accepted.
Optionally filter for only a DomainObject in a specific Domain SiteName, wildcards accepted.
Optional switch, ping the computer to ensure it's up before enumerating.
Optionally find only the first matching DomainObject.

member.summary: Gets `SPNTicket`s for specified `DomainObject`s.
member.param: List of DomainObjects with an SPN set.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Domain.DomainSearcher.GetDomainSPNTicket(SharpSploit.Enumeration.Domain.DomainObject)
member.summary: Get `SPNTicket` for specified `DomainObject`.
member.param: DomainObject with an SPN set.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Domain.DomainSearcher.Kerberoast(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{SharpSploit.Enumeration.Domain.UACEnum},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a list of `SPNTicket`s for specified (or all) users with a SPN set in the current Domain.
member.param: Username to Kerberoast of a user with an SPN set.
Optional LDAP filter when searching for users with an SPN set.
Optional filter to parse the userAccountControl DomainObject property.
If true, will only find a single SPNTicket for the first user found with an SPN set.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Domain.DomainSearcher.Kerberoast(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{SharpSploit.Enumeration.Domain.UACEnum})
member.summary: Gets a list of `SPNTicket`s for specified (or all) users with a SPN set in the current Domain.

Optional LDAP filter when searching for users with an SPN set.

member.name: T:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Net
member.summary: Net is a library for localgroup/domain enumeration that can be used to search for users, groups, loggedonusers, and sessions on remote systems using Win32 API functions.
member.remarks: Net is adapted from Will Schroeder's (@harmj0y) PowerView. (Found at https://github.com/PowerShellMafia/PowerSploit/blob/dev/Recon/PowerView.ps1)

member.name: T:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Net.LocalGroup
member.summary: LocalGroup represents a local group object on a remote system.

member.name: T:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Net.LocalGroupMember
member.summary: LocalGroupMember represents a user's membership to a local group on a remote system.

member.name: T:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Net.LoggedOnUser
member.summary: LoggedOnUser represents a user logged on to a remote system.

member.name: T:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Net.SessionInfo
member.summary: SessionInfo represents a user with a session on a remote system.

member.summary: Gets a list of `LocalGroup`s from a specified DomainCompter.

Credential to use for authentication to the DomainComputer.

member.param: List of ComputerNames to query for LocalGroups.
Credential to use for authentication to the ComputerNames.

member.name: T:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Host
member.summary: Host is a library for local host enumeration.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Host.GetProcessList
member.summary: Gets a list of running processes on the system.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Host.CreateProcessDump(System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates a minidump that represents the memory of a running process. Useful for offline Mimikatz if dumping the LSASS process. (Requires Admin)
member.param: Process ID of the process to generate a minidump for.
Path to write output file in. Defaults to the current directory.
Filename to ouput the minidump to.
member.remarks: Authored by Justin Bui (@youslydawg).

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Host.CreateProcessDump(System.String,System.String,System.String)

member.param: Name of the process to generate a minidump for.
Path to write output file in. Defaults to the current directory.
Filename to ouput the minidump to.
member.remarks: Authored by Justin Bui (@youslydawg).

member.summary: Generates a minidump that represents the memory of a running process. Useful for offline Mimikatz if dumping the LSASS process. (Requires Admin)
member.param: Process to generate a minidump for.
Path to write output file in. Defaults to the current directory.
Filename to ouput the minidump to.
member.remarks: Authored by Justin Bui (@youslydawg).

member.name: T:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Network
member.summary: Network is a library for network enumeration such as identifying live systems and open ports.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Network.PortScan(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Conducts a port scan of a specified ComputerName and port and reports if the port is open.
member.param: ComputerName to port scan.
Port to scan.
Optional switch. If true, pings the ComputerName to ensure it's up before port scanning.
Timeout (in milliseconds) before the port is considered down.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Network.PortScan(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String},System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Conducts a port scan of specified ComputerNames on a specified port and reports if the port is open.
member.param: ComputerNames to port scan.
Port to scan.
Optional switch. If true, pings the ComputerNames to ensure each is up before port scanning.
Timeout (in milliseconds) before a port is considered down.
Number of threads with which to portscan simultaneously

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Network.PortScan(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Int32},System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Conducts a port scan of a specified ComputerName on specified ports and reports open ports.
member.param: ComputerName to port scan.
Ports to scan.
Optional switch. If true, pings the ComputerName to ensure it's up before port scanning.
Timeout (in milliseconds) before a port is considered down.
Number of threads with which to portscan simultaneously

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Network.PortScan(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Int32},System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Conducts a port scan of specified ComputerNames on specified ports and reports open ports.
member.param: ComputerNames to port scan.
Ports to scan.
Optional switch. If true, pings the ComputerNames to ensure each is up before port scanning.
Timeout (in milliseconds) before a port is considered down.
Number of threads with which to portscan simultaneously

member.summary: Pings a specified ComputerName to identify if it is live.
member.param: ComputerName to ping.
Timeout (in milliseconds) before a ComputerName is considered down.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Enumeration.Network.Ping(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Pings specified ComputerNames to identify live systems.
member.param: ComputerNames to ping.
Timeout (in milliseconds) before a ComputerName is considered down.
Number of threads with which to ping simultaneously

member.summary: Loads a specified .NET assembly byte array and executes the EntryPoint.

The name of the type that contains the method to execute.
The name of the method to execute.
The parameters to pass to the method.

The name of the type that contains the method to execute.
The name of the method to execute.
The parameters to pass to the method.

member.name: T:SharpSploit.Execution.PE
member.summary: PE is a library for loading PEs in memory. It currently only work for the Mimikatz PE, not for arbitrary PEs.
member.remarks: PE has been adapted from Casey Smith's (@subtee) PELoader which is no longer available online. However, Chris Ross' (@xorrior) fork is available here: https://github.com/xorrior/Random-CSharpTools/tree/master/DllLoader/DllLoader

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Execution.PE.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: PE Constructor
member.param: PE raw bytes.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Execution.PE.Load(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Loads a PE with a specified byte array. (Requires Admin) **(*Currently broken. Works for Mimikatz, but not arbitrary PEs*)

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Execution.PE.GetFunctionExport(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a pointer to an exported function in the PE. Useful to call specific exported functions after loading the PE.
member.param: Name of the function to get a pointer for.

member.name: T:SharpSploit.Execution.Shell
member.summary: Shell is a library for executing shell commands.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Execution.Shell.PowerShellExecute(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes specified PowerShell code using System.Management.Automation.dll and bypasses AMSI, ScriptBlock Logging, and Module Logging (but not Transcription Logging).
member.param: PowerShell code to execute.
Switch. If true, appends Out-String to the PowerShellCode to execute.
Switch. If true, bypasses ScriptBlock and Module logging.
Switch. If true, bypasses AMSI.
member.remarks: Credit for the AMSI bypass goes to Matt Graeber (@mattifestation). Credit for the ScriptBlock/Module logging bypass goes to Lee Christensen (@_tifkin).

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Execution.Shell.ShellExecute(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Executes a specified Shell command, optionally with an alternative username and password. Equates to `ShellExecuteWithPath(ShellCommand, "C:\\WINDOWS\\System32")`.
member.param: The ShellCommand to execute, including any arguments.
Optional alternative username to execute ShellCommand as.
Optional alternative Domain of the username to execute ShellCommand as.
Optional password to authenticate the username to execute the ShellCommand as.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Execution.Shell.ShellCmdExecute(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Executes a specified Shell command using cmd.exe, optionally with an alternative username and password. Equates to `ShellExecute("cmd.exe /c " + ShellCommand)`.
member.param: The ShellCommand to execute, including any arguments.
Optional alternative username to execute ShellCommand as.
Optional alternative Domain of the username to execute ShellCommand as.
Optional password to authenticate the username to execute the ShellCommand as.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Execution.Shell.ShellExecuteWithPath(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Executes a specified Shell command from a specified directory, optionally with an alternative username and password.
member.param: The ShellCommand to execute, including any arguments.
The Path of the directory from which to execute the ShellCommand.
Optional alternative username to execute ShellCommand as.
Optional alternative Domain of the username to execute ShellCommand as.
Optional password to authenticate the username to execute the ShellCommand as.

member.name: T:SharpSploit.Execution.ShellCode
member.summary: ShellCode includes a method for executing shellcode.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Execution.ShellCode.ShellCodeExecute(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Executes a specified ShellCode byte array by copying it to pinned memory, modifying the memory permissions with VirtualProtect(), and executing using a delegate.
member.param: ShellCode byte array to execute.
member.returns: Boolean. True if execution succeeds, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Based upon code written by Matt Nelson (@enigma0x3) and Matt Graeber (@mattifestation).

member.name: T:SharpSploit.Execution.Win32
member.summary: Win32 is a library of PInvoke signatures for Win32 API functions.
member.remarks: A majority of this library is adapted from signatures found at www.pinvoke.net.

member.name: T:SharpSploit.Generic.GenericObjectResult
member.summary: GenericObjectResult for listing objects whose type is unknown at compile time.

member.name: T:SharpSploit.Generic.SharpSploitResultList`1
member.summary: SharpSploitResultList extends the IList interface for SharpSploitResults to easily format a list of results from various SharpSploit functions.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Generic.SharpSploitResultList`1.FormatList
member.summary: Formats a SharpSploitResultList to a string similar to PowerShell's Format-List function.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Generic.SharpSploitResultList`1.ToString
member.summary: Formats a SharpSploitResultList as a string. Overrides ToString() for convenience.

member.name: T:SharpSploit.Generic.SharpSploitResult
member.summary: Abstract class that represents a result from a SharpSploit function.

member.name: T:SharpSploit.Generic.SharpSploitResultProperty
member.summary: SharpSploitResultProperty represents a property that is a member of a SharpSploitResult's ResultProperties.

member.name: T:SharpSploit.LateralMovement.DCOM
member.summary: DCOM is a class for executing DCOM lateral movement techniques.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.LateralMovement.DCOM.DCOMExecute(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,SharpSploit.LateralMovement.DCOM.DCOMMethod)
member.summary: Execute a process on a remote system using various DCOM methods.
member.param: ComputerName of remote system to execute process.
Command to execute on remote system.
DCOM execution method to use. Defaults to MMC20.Application.
member.returns: Bool. True if execution succeeds, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Credit for the DCOM lateral movement techniques goes to Matt Nelson (@enigma0x3). This is a port of Steve Borosh (rvrshell)'s Invoke-DCOM implementation available here: https://github.com/rvrsh3ll/Misc-Powershell-Scripts/blob/master/Invoke-DCOM.ps1

member.name: M:SharpSploit.LateralMovement.DCOM.DCOMExecute(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.String,System.String,System.String,SharpSploit.LateralMovement.DCOM.DCOMMethod)
member.summary: Execute a process on a remote system using various DCOM methods.
member.param: ComputerNames of remote systems to execute process.
Command to execute on remote system.
DCOM execution method to use. Defaults to MMC20.Application.
member.returns: Bool. True if execution succeeds, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Credit for the DCOM lateral movement techniques goes to Matt Nelson (@enigma0x3). This is a port of Steve Borosh (rvrshell)'s Invoke-DCOM implementation available here: https://github.com/rvrsh3ll/Misc-Powershell-Scripts/blob/master/Invoke-DCOM.ps1

member.name: T:SharpSploit.LateralMovement.WMI
member.summary: WMI is a class for executing WMI lateral movement techniques.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.LateralMovement.WMI.WMIExecute(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Execute a process on a remote system using the WMI Win32_Process.Create method.
member.param: ComputerName of remote system to execute process.
Command to execute on remote system.
Username to authenticate as to the remote system.
Password to authenticate the user.
member.returns: Bool. True if execution succeeds, false otherwise.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.LateralMovement.WMI.WMIExecute(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Execute a process on a remote system using the WMI Win32_Process.Create method.
member.param: ComputerNames of remote systems to execute process.
Command to execute on remote system.
Username to authenticate as to the remote system.
Password to authenticate the user.
member.returns: Bool. True if execution succeeds, false otherwise.

member.name: T:SharpSploit.Misc.CountdownEvent
member.summary: CountdownEvent is used for counting Asynchronous operations

member.name: T:SharpSploit.Persistence.COM
member.summary: COM is a class for abusing the Microsoft Component Object Model to establish peristence.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.Persistence.COM.HijackCLSID(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Hijacks a CLSID key to execute a payload.
member.author: Dennis Panagiotopoulos (@den_n1s)
member.returns: Bool. True if execution succeeds, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Credit to Ruben Boonen (@FuzzySec) for his PowerShell implementation of this technique.
member.param: Missing CLSID to abuse.
Path to the executable payload.

member.summary: Exchange is a class for abusing Microsoft Exchange for privilege escalation.

member.name: M:SharpSploit.PrivilegeEscalation.Exchange.PrivExchangePushNotification(System.String,System.String,SharpSploit.PrivilegeEscalation.Exchange.ExchangeVersion)
member.summary: Performs the "PrivExchange" attack to abuse Exchange EWS to subscribe to push notifications to relay the Exchange authentication. This attack relies on the use of a relay constructed outside of SharpSploit.
member.author: Dennis Panagiotopoulos (@den_n1s)
member.param: The URI of the Exchange EWS instance to perform the relay against. For example: http(s)://[hostname]:[port]/EWS/Exchange.asmx.
Set the attacker's IP.
Microsoft Exchange version. Defaults to Exchange2010.
member.returns: Bool. True if execution succeeds, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Credits to Dirk-jan Molemma (@_dirkjan) for the discovery of this attack and Dave Cossa (@G0ldenGunSec) for his PowerShell implementation.
